articles.headline: Voters in Mexico Cement the Governing Party’s Dominance
articles.snippet: Expectations were high for the leftist Morena party, and it exceeded them, potentially giving President-elect Claudia Sheinbaum and her allies the power to enact systemic change.
articles.abstract: Expectations were high for the leftist Morena party, and it exceeded them, potentially giving President-elect Claudia Sheinbaum and her allies the power to enact systemic change.
articles.lead_paragraph: The margin of Claudia Sheinbaum’s election as Mexico’s president was the biggest in decades, and even as the votes were still being counted on Monday, it became clear that Mexico’s leftist governing party and its allies could be in a position to reshape the country’s political landscape.
articles.byline: By Simon Romero, Natalie Kitroeff and Emiliano Rodríguez Mega

articles.headline: The Low-Key British Newshound Taking Charge of The Washington Post
articles.snippet: Robert Winnett is virtually unknown in the U.S. and keeps a low profile in his native Britain, too. This fall, he will oversee the newsroom of Woodward and Bernstein.
articles.abstract: Robert Winnett is virtually unknown in the U.S. and keeps a low profile in his native Britain, too. This fall, he will oversee the newsroom of Woodward and Bernstein.
articles.lead_paragraph: In the swashbuckling world of British newspapers, the editor Robert Winnett stands out for his lack of flash. Taciturn and low key, more likely to be buried in documents at his desk than hobnobbing at a Mayfair club, Mr. Winnett, the deputy editor of The Daily Telegraph, is known for his focus on breaking news, once earning the nickname “Rat Boy” for his relentless drive for scoops.

articles.headline: As China’s Internet Disappears, ‘We Lose Parts of Our Collective Memory’
articles.snippet: The number of Chinese websites is shrinking and posts are being removed and censored, stoking fears about what happens when history is erased.
articles.abstract: The number of Chinese websites is shrinking and posts are being removed and censored, stoking fears about what happens when history is erased.
articles.lead_paragraph: Chinese people know their country’s internet is different. There is no Google, YouTube, Facebook or Twitter. They use euphemisms online to communicate the things they are not supposed to mention. When their posts and accounts are censored, they accept it with resignation.

articles.headline: House Democrats Begin Bid to Force Contraceptive Vote, Pressuring G.O.P.
articles.snippet: By starting a discharge petition on legislation to codify the right to contraceptive access, Democrats aim to spotlight Republican opposition to the bill, part of a broader push to highlight the issue for voters.
articles.abstract: By starting a discharge petition on legislation to codify the right to contraceptive access, Democrats aim to spotlight Republican opposition to the bill, part of a broader push to highlight the issue for voters.
articles.lead_paragraph: House Democrats on Tuesday went on the offensive on reproductive rights, announcing they will seek to force a vote on legislation to codify the right to birth control access nationwide.

articles.headline: OpenAI Insiders Warn of a ‘Reckless’ Race for Dominance
articles.snippet: A group of current and former employees is calling for sweeping changes to the artificial intelligence industry, including greater transparency and protections for whistle-blowers.
articles.abstract: A group of current and former employees is calling for sweeping changes to the artificial intelligence industry, including greater transparency and protections for whistle-blowers.
articles.lead_paragraph: A group of OpenAI insiders is blowing the whistle on what they say is a culture of recklessness and secrecy at the San Francisco artificial intelligence company, which is racing to build the most powerful A.I. systems ever created.

articles.headline: San Diego Is Once Again a Top Migrant Entry Point
articles.snippet: Asylum seekers from around the world are trying to enter the United States through California, and immigrant traffic there has reached its highest level in decades.
articles.abstract: Asylum seekers from around the world are trying to enter the United States through California, and immigrant traffic there has reached its highest level in decades.
articles.lead_paragraph: From sunrise to sunset, the U.S. Border Patrol buses arrived every hour at a sunbaked parking lot in San Diego.
articles.byline: By Jonathan Wolfe and Mark Abramson
